title: Marcus Rashford shows off forgotten 2008 advert which he appeared in with Sir Bobby Charlton
text:
Marcus Rashford has posted a touching birthday message to Manchester United legend Bobby Charlton and revealed he was in a TV ad with him when he was 10.

In the 2008 advert, for yogurt drink maker Actimel, Rashford joins a host of kids kicking a ball in a muddy park when the World Cup Winner - who turns 82 today - is out walking his dog before stunning the children with a ferocious strike.

The current Manchester United number 10 took to Instagram to reveal Charlton has been an inspiration to him throughout his time at the Old Trafford club, and even before.

In the 2008 advert, for yogurt drink maker Actimel, Rashford joins a host of kids kicking a ball

He wrote: 'As a kid I was so excited to be in this video with a United & England legend. ‬

'From then until now, he's a constant reminder of how big an honour it is to play for both.‬ ‪Happy Birthday, Sir Bobby.'

Sir Bobby played 758 times for United after making his debut, ironically, against Charlton - in 1956. He scored 249 goals.

Charlton - who turns 82 today - is walking his dog before stunning the children with a strike

The current Manchester United number 10 took to Instagram to reveal the 2008 advert

While Rashford is leading the line for his club, he played a bit part in the advert that was fronted by another Mancunian youngster, called Jordan Hill.

The then 11-year-old revealed to the Manchester Evening News at the time that Sir Bobby sent him the flat cap he wore in the commercial in the post after he asked for it during filming.

'He played football with me in between takes and he talked to me a lot, it was great,' the actor added.

He wrote: 'As a kid I was so excited to be in this video with a United & England legend'

Rashford, pictured against Arsenal, shared the clip with a birthday message for Charlton

None other than David Beckham also met the great man when he was a child, after winning the Bobby Charlton Soccer School.

A famous picture shows a young floppy-haired Beckham posing with a beaming Charlton as they shake hands.

Bobby Charlton Soccer School was the UK's first ever football education centre and has been running for over 40 years, churning out over 1,000,000 players according to the website.
description: In the 2008 advert, for yogurt drink maker Actimel, Rashford joins a host of kids kicking a ball in a muddy park when the World Cup Winner - who turns 82 today - stuns them with his skill.
